page.title: 05Changes in Village Life
page.content: Mrs Pearson has lived in Scalford all her life and was married here 40 years ago. She says that Scalford has changed a great deal since her marriage. There were more shops in 1945 so that the people didn't need to go to town so often. There was a skittle alley in the pub called the Plough, and many more clubs and activities for the villagers to enjoy. Now many of these have disappeared or changed. Queens Close was a play area then for the village children, where they used to play such games as whip and top, as well as football.Now houses have been built there. More people worked in the village then, now most people travel out to work. Mrs Pearson feels that Scalford was a closer community in those days, although it is still a friendly place.
